com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveNodeIf

All Superinterfaces:
Node
All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveArcIf, XhiveBlobNodeIf, XhiveDocumentIf, XhiveExtendedLinkIf, XhiveLibraryChildIf, XhiveLibraryIf, XhiveLinkBaseIf, XhiveLocatorIf, XhiveResourceIf, XhiveSimpleLinkIf, XhiveTitleIf
public interface XhiveNodeIf
extends Node

Extends the org.w3c.dom.Node interface to include additional convenience methods and X-Hive/DB properties.

The interface provides the following extensions to the org.w3c.dom.Node interface:

  • Executing XQuery, XPath and XPointer expressions.

  • Convenience methods for traversing nodes.

  • TreeWalkers to traverse elements by tag name.

  • Function object support.

  • XLink identification.

  • Conversion from node to XML string.

You can cast any X-Hive/DB object that implements the DOM Node interface to XhiveNodeIf.

Function Objects

XhiveNodeIf provides function object support. The use of function objects enables separation between traversal methods and function methods. Furthermore, it enables reuse of function classes.
Function classes must implement the XhiveFunctionIf interface.
XhiveNodeIf provides traversal methods for applying a function object to a single node, the ancestors of a node, the children of a node, or the descendants of a node.

Traversing Elements by Tagname

DOM Level 2 supports searches for elements (by name) within documents and elements by providing the methods:
NodeList getElementsByTagName(String tagname) and NodeList getElementsByTagNameNS(String namespaceURI, String localName)
Traversal of the elements of a 'live' nodelist is not optimized in the current DOM implementation. To traverse elements of given name, it is recommended that you use the XhiveTreeWalkerIf instead.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getNextNodeInDocOrder

Node getNextNodeInDocOrder(Node contextNode)
Returns the next node in document order (pre-order) relative to a specified context node. The context node is the starting point of the traversal. Returns null when the next node is equal to the context node.

Parameters:
contextNode - the starting point of traversal.
Returns:
The next node in document order, or null when traversal is finished.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getPreviousNodeInDocOrder

Node getPreviousNodeInDocOrder(Node contextNode)
Returns the previous node in document order (pre-order) relative to a specified context node. The context node is the starting point of the traversal. Returns null when this node is equal to the context node.

Parameters:
contextNode - the starting point of traversal.
Returns:
The next node in document order, or null when traversal is finished.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getElementsByTagNameWalker

XhiveTreeWalkerIf getElementsByTagNameWalker(java.lang.String tagname)
Returns an XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse all descending elements of given name in pre-order (document order).

Parameters:
tagname - the name of the tag to match on. The special value "*" matches all tags.
Returns:
An XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse all descending elements of given name in pre-order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getElementsByTagNameWalkerNS

XhiveTreeWalkerIf getElementsByTagNameWalkerNS(java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                               java.lang.String localName)
Returns an XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse all descending elements of given local name and namespace URI in pre-order (document order).

Parameters:
namespaceURI - the namespaceURI to match on. The special value "*" matches all namespaceURI's.
localName - the local name of the element to match on. The special value "*" matches all local names.
Returns:
An XhiveTreeWalkerIf to traverse all descending elements of given name and namespaceURI in pre-order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

apply

void apply(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Applies the function object to this node. Execution of apply in semi-code:
if (fun.test(this)){ fun.process(this) }

Parameters:
fun - the function object for testing and processing the node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
XhiveFunctionIf

traverseChildren

void traverseChildren(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses the children and applies the function object to every child. Execution of traverseChildren in semi-code:
Node child = this.getFirstChild();
while(child != null && !fun.isDone(child)){
child.apply(fun);
child = child.getNextSibling();
}

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all children of this node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseAncestors

void traverseAncestors(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses the ancestors and applies the function object to every ancestor, including XhiveLibraryIf objects. Execution of traverseAncestors in semi-code:
Node parent = this.getParentNode();
while(parent != null && !fun.isDone(parent)){
parent.apply(fun);
parent = parent.getParentNode();
}

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all ancestors of this node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseDocumentOrder

void traverseDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses this node and all its descendants in document order, and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node. Execution of traverseDocumentOrder in semi-code:
Node node = this;
while(node != null && !fun.isDone(node)){
node.apply(fun);
node = node.getNextNodeInDocumentOrder(this);
}

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all encountered nodes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseReverseDocumentOrder

void traverseReverseDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses the current node and all of its descendants in reverse document order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node. Execution is similar to traverseDocumentOrder, except that all nodes are encountered in reverse order. The last node encountered is the current node.

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all encountered nodes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseAttributesDocumentOrder

void traverseAttributesDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses the attributes of this node and its descendant's nodes in document order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered attribute. Execution is similar to traverseDocumentOrder, except that only attributes of a an encountered node are visited.

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all encountered attributes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseAllNodesDocumentOrder

void traverseAllNodesDocumentOrder(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses this node and all descending nodes, including attributes in document order, and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node, including attributes. Execution is similar to traverseDocumentOrder, except that not only descending nodes are encounterd, but also attributes.

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all encountered nodes, including attributes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

traverseBreadthFirst

void traverseBreadthFirst(XhiveFunctionIf fun)
Traverses this node and all its descendants in 'breadth first' order and applies XhiveFunctionIf to every encountered node. Execution is similar to traverseDocumentOrder, except that the traversal order is 'breadth first'.

Parameters:
fun - the function object to apply to all encountered nodes.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

createXQuery

XhiveXQueryQueryIf createXQuery(java.lang.String query)
Create an XQuery query.

This method parses the given query and returns an object representing it. The XhiveXQueryQueryIf object can then be used to set external variables, register functions and finally execute the query.

Module imports within the query are resolved relative to this node, all other paths are resolved at runtime. Use XhiveXQueryQueryIf.executeOn(XhiveNodeIf) to execute the same query in different contexts.

Parameters:
query - the XQuery statement
Returns:
an XhiveXQueryQueryIf containing the parsed query.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7
See Also:
XhiveXQueryQueryIf, XhiveXQueryQueryIf.executeOn(XhiveNodeIf)

executeXQuery

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveXQueryValueIf> executeXQuery(java.lang.String query)
Execute an XQuery query.

Execute an XQuery query, using this library child as the root for any path expressions not starting with a call to the xf:document() function. The values returned by the iterator should be cast to a XhiveXQueryValueIf.

Any nodes created in the query are created in a temporary document and should not be used after the transaction they are created in is aborted or committed.

The query is executed relative to the current DomNode, e.g. expressions starting from a context node in the top level of the query are evaluated relative to this node.

This method is equivalent and a shorthand to calling createXQuery() and executing the query afterwards.

Parameters:
query - the query to be executed
Returns:
An iterator with all the values of the result sequence of the query.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
The XQuery specification

executeXQuery

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveXQueryValueIf> executeXQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                                               XhiveDocumentIf creationDocument)
Execute an XQuery query.

Execute an XQuery query, using this library child as the root for any absolute path expressions not starting with a call to the xf:document() function. The values returned by the iterator should be cast to a XhiveXQueryValueIf.

The query is executed relative to the current DomNode, e.g. expressions starting from a context node in the top level of the query are evaluated relative to this node.

Parameters:
query - the query to be executed
creationDocument - The document that will be the owner for all nodes created in the query.
Returns:
An iterator with all the values of the result sequence of the query.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
The XQuery specification

createXPathContext

XhiveXPathContextIf createXPathContext()
Creates a new XPathContext. A XPathContext represents the absolute root for the query and can contain namespace, variable and functon bindings.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

isLink

boolean isLink()
XLink method. Returns true if the node is a link conforming to the XLink standard.

Returns:
true if the node is a link conforming to the XLink standard.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getLinkType

java.lang.String getLinkType()
XLink method. If the node is a link conforming to the XLink standard, the linktype is returned. Otherwise, an empty string is returned.

Returns:
The linktype if the node is a link, otherwise an empty string.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Returns:

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1.1

toXml

void toXml(java.io.Writer output,
           boolean beautify)
           throws java.io.IOException
Serialize the node as an XML Writer.

Parameters:
output - The stream to write the serialized tree to. If you have a slow writer (e.g., a java.io.FileWriter), consider wrapping it in a java.io.BufferedWriter.

Make sure the Writer is created with the encoding that you want the document be serialized in. You may also consider using DOM Load/ Save's LSSerializer instead.

beautify - When false, the DOM is serialized as is, when true the output is indented.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1.1
See Also:
LSSerializer

toXml

java.io.Reader toXml(LSSerializer serializer)
Create a reader that provides the contents of the node. All settings of the provided serializer are used. The reader is valid as long as the transaction is open. If the node or its descendants are modified between calls to this reader, the results are undefined.

This method is currently implemented by serializing the node in a new thread. This means that any error handler set on the configuration of the serializer may be called in a different thread than the one that calls the read() method of the reader.

If the contents are required as an InputStream, consider using a ReaderInputStream.

Parameters:
serializer - The serializer to use for the serialization.
Returns:
A Reader with the contents of the node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getSchemaTypeInfo

TypeInfo getSchemaTypeInfo()
The type information associated with this attribute. This funtion is only supported by Attr and Element.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1 & DOM Level 3
